Issues.Title: Introduce and use TraceVerbose extension method
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

- Introduce and use TraceVerbose extension method
- Addresses https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8072#discussion_r1009826425
- Since this involves many changes, we can use the method in System.Windows.Forms.Design in a separate PR.
- We can also introduce TraceInfo and other extension methods in a separate PR.

Issues.Title: FolderBrowserDialog throws AccessViolationException and crashes when creating a new folder in a USB drive with no space available
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

6.0.10

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

The issue happens when trying to create a new folder in a USB flash drive with no space available through FolderBrowserDialog or SaveFileDialog.

USB Device:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14222884/200080315-a9984053-3590-4a3b-8109-dc94482defe4.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14222884/200082157-6cd44b7d-174c-4f9d-899c-96d53c1650ed.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14222884/200082951-dbcc1ec1-cd78-45bd-bd39-062711eb27d8.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14222884/200079421-73a8047a-e050-4443-ada7-fc942a1c9479.png)

The reference screenshots for this test show a Windows install flash drive with a NTFS partition, but it also happened in previous tests with FAT flash drives.

This issue was originally discovered in a .NET Framework 4.8 application but seems to occur in the .NET 6 implementation as well.

I also tried reproducing the issue in multiple machines with different devices, still persists.

Using a virtual disk (simulating a device with no space available) had the expected behaviour (another dialog shows up notifying the user there's no space available and suggesting them to clean up the device).

Could this be a shell problem? During these tests I figured the issue also seems to happen with explorer.exe itself, I can consistently crash it by trying to create a folder under the same conditions described.

### Steps to reproduce

* Open a FolderBrowserDialog (or SaveFileDialog) with the ShowDialog() method
* Select a full USB device (0 bytes available)
* Create a new folder from within the dialog, either through the context menu option or the New Folder button, in said device
    - Creating the folder with the top left "New Folder" button causes the AccessViolationException to be thrown
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14222884/200083410-d574f2e8-209b-43cb-bfd4-a49ea2d20a45.png)
    - Creating the folder with the context menu option causes the application to crash silently with no exceptions, even when "EnableUnmanagedDebugging" is set to true (this seems to show more information in the .NET Framework 4.8 version)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "FolderBrowserDialog throws AccessViolationException and crashes when creating a new folder in a USB drive with no space available" (#8116)

Issues.Title: An exception thrown when opening FileDialog with non-existing InitialDirectory
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22552.11

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, cannot repro previous released .Net versions

### Issue description

An exception thrown when opening FileDialog with filters

**.Net 8.0:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/199679299-0b3aba10-507a-4587-8aad-847764d7d751.png)
_System.NullReferenceException
  HResult=0x80004003
  Message=Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
  Source=System.Windows.Forms.Primitives
  StackTrace:
   at Windows.Win32.UI.Shell.IShellItem.Release()
   at System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog.OnBeforeVistaDialog(IFileDialog* dialog)
   at System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog.TryRunDialogVista(HWND hWndOwner, Boolean& returnValue)
   at System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog.RunDialog(IntPtr hWndOwner)
   at System.Windows.Forms.CommonDialog.ShowDialog(IWin32Window owner)
   at WinFormsApp1.Form1.button1_Click(Object sender, EventArgs e) in C:\Users\xxx\source\repos\WinFormsApp1\WinFormsApp1\Form1.cs:line 17_

**.Net 7.0:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/199679610-102e2766-5691-4ee7-9e8e-aa13084ee208.png)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Winforms .Net 8.0 application
2. Add a button to form designer, and double-click it to generate event
3. Add following code:
```
string imagePath = "";
OpenFileDialog open = new OpenFileDialog();
open.InitialDirectory = "C:\Users\Public\Pictures\Sample Pictures";
open.Filter = ".jpg,.jpeg,.bmp,.gif,.ico,.png,.tif,.wmf|.jpg;.jpeg;.bmg;.gif;.ico;.png;.tif;.wmf";
open.Title = "choose picture";
if (open.ShowDialog() == DialogResult.OK)
{
MessageBox.Show("OpenfileDialog is opened");
}
```
4. Build and run to click button

Or using attached simple repro application:
[WinFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/9926806/WinFormsApp1.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "An exception thrown when opening FileDialog with non-existing InitialDirectory" (#8108)

Issues.Title: designer form doesn't take care about window state Activation
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2019
Version 16.11.20

### .NET version

.NET Core 3.1 and.NET 5

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

No

### Issue description

designer doesn't take care about window state Activation state of form



### Steps to reproduce

open new form in design mode click Properties

![2022-11-02_23-31-26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12494184/199615964-4e0ad472-6918-49f6-806a-8e980f656371.gif)

.net framwork

![2022-11-02_23-34-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12494184/199616300-03c8f29c-2e75-4d42-adca-595b7b3a64af.gif)



### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "designer form doesn't take care about window state Activation" (#8107)

Issues.Title: Use IStorage*/IStream* Instead of Interface
Issues.Body:
- Use IStream*/IStorage* instead of interface where appropriate
- Convert `CreateILockBytesOnHGlobal`,`GetHGlobalFromILockBytes`,`StgCreateDocfileOnILockBytes`,`StgOpenStorageOnILockBytes` to cswin32
- Remove LockBytesWrapper
- Implement basic dispose pattern in AxHost.State to release unmanaged resources
- Update IPersistStorage::Load/Save methods to return correct HRESULT value

Issues.Title: Fixed disabled ToolStripMenuItem checkmark rendering in HC themes
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #7980


## Proposed changes

- Disabled checkmark is now rendered with the same code as other disabled images on ToolStrip
 

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Better visual difference between enabled and disabled menu items

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

Windows 11, .NET 7:
![before_win11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/113603457/199568304-87df149f-82fc-4021-94d8-bd109174f86c.png)

Windows 10, .NET 7:
![before_win10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/113603457/199568338-00144ff9-ec31-4ebd-ad36-2f2323ca2792.png)

### After

Windows 11, .NET 7:
![after_win11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/113603457/199568385-1b4447c8-58bb-44b6-9044-3925c4d416a3.png)

Windows 10, .NET 7:
![after_win10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/113603457/199568463-1ce9c54f-0296-4052-945c-2e4c591fe951.png)

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .NET SDK 7.0.100-rc.2.22477.23
- Windows 11

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Form cannot be focused and announced by Narrator automatically when launching app's exe from debug folder
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22551.5

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, repro in previous all versions

### Issue description

Form cannot be focused and announced by Narrator automatically when launching app's exe from debug folder

.Net 8.0:
![Form_8 0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/199459985-975bbdb1-7d79-4352-be20-62a328bb71b2.gif)

.Net framework 4.8.1:
![Form_framework481](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/199460019-0ae99a21-1f4a-4899-9de0-d45e3151d622.gif)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Winforms .net application with targeting .net 8.0
2. Build application
3. In file explorer, find this application and go to debug->**net8.0-windows** folder
4. Launch Narrator and click app's exe
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Form cannot be focused and announced by Narrator automatically when launching app's exe from debug folder" (#8098)
